page.title: 20Old Burham
page.content: Near the River Medway stands St. Mary's Church Burham.It was originally built by the Normans and held by the Knights Hospitalers until the Dissolution.As the newer houses were built further away from the river in the nineteenth century, the church was closed.After a long period of disuse the Church was re-hallowed on 16th September 1965 by the Bishop of Rochester. Nearby are the derelict buildings of Burham Cement Works. During the middle of the nineteenth century the village of Burham had grown rapidly as the cement industry flourished.By the end of the century Burham Works were facing difficulties, closing down in 1908 but re-opening soon after. The Works closed in 1930 but continued to quarry & produce clinker for other cement factories in the area.
